question_sentence: Which country's men's basketball team were greeted by the wrong national anthem after a blunder by Olympics organisers?
evidence: The "Bright Stars" were introduced before their opening match with the national anthem of neighbouring Sudan. The audio was stopped as spectators jeered and replaced with the correct anthem, and South Sudan went on to defeat the Puerto Rican team 90-79.

question_sentence: What reform to the US Supreme Court did Joe Biden propose on Monday?
evidence: President Joe Biden announced a series of legislative reforms, including term limits, a code of ethics for Supreme Court justices, and rolling back the expansive presidential immunity granted to Donald Trump last month.

question_sentence: Which Democratic governor is credited with popularising the term "weird" to describe Donald Trump and his allies?
evidence: The Minnesota governor's comment that Trump was a "strange, weird dude" during a "White Dudes for Harris" online fundraiser on Monday has kick-started a new line of attack for the Democratic campaign, one focused on their opponents' perceived strangeness.

question_sentence: In the largest US/Russia prisoner swap since the Cold War, how many Americans will return to the States?
evidence: Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich is among the American detainees who have been allowed to leave Russian prisons in a deal that also sees eight Russians released from detention in the US and other Western nations to return to their home country.

question_sentence: Senior Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh was killed by a rocket strike while in which city?
evidence: Iran has vowed a "harsh and painful response" to Israel, which has yet to publicly claim responsibility for the apparent assassination of Haniyeh, who was in the Iranian capital for the inauguration of incoming president Masoud Pezeshkian.

question_sentence: Unionised employees from Maryland reached a collective bargaining deal with which tech company?
evidence: The tech giant has established its first labour agreement, not only for an Apple retail store but for any American employees of the company. The agreement remains subject to approval by the 85 unionised employees but includes a 10% pay increase.

question_sentence: "Iron Man" star Robert Downey Jr stunned fans when he confirmed he was returning to the Marvel universe as what villain?
evidence: If you know only one thing about the Marvel Cinematic Universe, it's that Robert Downey Jr plays Iron Man. So how does charismatic plutocrat Tony Stark become mad scientist Doctor Doom? Well, it's a bit complicated, but we've had a crack at breaking it down…

question_sentence: The Park Fire, a wildfire in Northern California, has grown to cover an area larger than which city?
evidence: The Park Fire has burned over 390,000 acres and is one of the largest wildfires in the state's history. It is one of several blazes currently in the western US and Canada.

question_sentence: Swimming experts blamed the lack of world records being set at the Paris Games on what?
evidence: Swimmers have said that the hastily constructed facility at La Defense Arena, ordinarily a rugby stadium, is a "slow pool" because it is unusually shallow – 2.15 metres. That is well below the three metres recommended as optimal by Fina, the sport's governing body.

question_sentence: Residents of Nairobi are in uproar over the city's plans to tax ownership of which animal?
evidence: The so-called "cat tax"– a 200 Kenyan shilling (£1.20) mandatory annual licence for all pet cats in Nairobi – comes at a time of tension and mass protest in Kenya over tax rises intended to offset the country's debts.

question_sentence: Which athlete is the most decorated American gymnast of all time?
evidence: After winning the team gold on Tuesday and gold in the individual all-around on Thursday, Biles now holds the most Olympic medals of any US gymnast in history, adding to her title as the most decorated gymnast of all time.

question_sentence: Which app informed users this week that some of their photos were permanently deleted?
evidence: Some Instagram posters got a shocking notification from the app Wednesday: Certain photos have been permanently deleted from the app’s Stories archives due to a technical issue.

question_sentence: Gabriel Medina of Brazil posted a near-perfect 9.90 score at the Olympic surfing competition. Which island is hosting the surfing events this year?
evidence: The entirety of the surfing competition is taking place on Tahiti, the largest island in French Polynesia. Medina achieved the highest-scoring wave in Olympic history — and went viral for this epic photo after his impressive victory.

question_sentence: Which state has the largest homeless population in the US?
evidence: California has the largest homeless population in the US, with more than 180,000 of the estimated 653,000 people experiencing homelessness nationwide residing in the Golden State, federal data shows. This week, San Francisco officials announced the city will enforce penalties to clear homeless encampments.

question_sentence: Which politician removed himself from consideration as Vice President Kamala Harris’ running mate?
evidence: North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper on Monday said it isn’t the right time for him to join a national ticket. Cooper was approached by the Harris campaign about being vetted, and he declined, a source familiar told CNN.

question_sentence: Which theme park was soaked in murky floodwaters this week?
evidence: Patrons at Dolly Parton’s theme park, Dollywood, were seen helping each other wade through knee-deep water following a torrential downpour.

question_sentence: Which food item has been linked to a widespread listeria outbreak in the US?
evidence: A recall of Boar’s Head deli meat linked with a listeria outbreak has been expanded to include 7 million additional pounds of products. Dozens of cases have been reported in at least 13 states, including two deaths, according to the USDA.

question_sentence: California is battling the fifth-largest wildfire in state history. What is the name of the blaze?
evidence: The Park Fire in northern California has destroyed hundreds of structures and is estimated to be bigger than the size of Los Angeles.

question_sentence: Which country was wracked with protests this week following its disputed presidential election?
evidence: Criticism is mounting against Venezuela’s authoritarian leader Nicolás Maduro after deadly protests erupted across the country following its disputed presidential election.

question_sentence: Which iconic “Star Wars” costume piece recently sold at auction for $175,000?
evidence: The iconic golden bikini worn by Carrie Fisher on the set of “Return of the Jedi” has sold at auction for $175,000.

question_sentence: Which of the following is the most popular ice cream flavor in Delaware?
Which hospital was ranked as the top hospital in Delaware by U.S. News and World Reports?
What does the Old Farmer’s Almanac predict for Delaware’s autumn temperatures in 2024?
What was the median sold price of homes in Delaware in June 2024?
What is the main reason ChristianaCare filed a lawsuit against Delaware House Bill 350?
choices: It mandates hospitals to increase their budgets annually.
It requires hospitals to disclose confidential information and submit to a state-appointed board.
It reduces the number of hospital staff.

question_sentence: What was the primary method used by the Delaware Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control (DNREC) to detect West Nile virus in the state for the first time in 2024?
What is one of the notable construction projects planned for Newark, Delaware, in 2024?
What is the name of the shopping center where Hangry Joe’s Hot Chicken & Wings will open its first Delaware location?
What recent accolade did Longwood Gardens receive according to the article?
choices: Prettiest Botanical Garden in the World
Largest Botanical Garden in North America

question_sentence: Which new destinations will Avelo Airlines start flying to from Wilmington Airport in early November 2024?
choices: Fort Myers, Florida and Hartford, Connecticut
Concord, North Carolina and Lakeland, Florida
